description.narrative: - HHC will provide 30 households with new hutches or pigsties and improved breeds of rabbits and pigs, as beneficiaries have identified a huge need for smallscale livelihoods activities and this will contribute to improving their lives and livelihoods. They will be trained on elementary livelihoods skills (agriculture, pastoral, micro enterprises, etc.) and will participate in constructing new equipment to accommodate their new livelihoods options. Learning and exchange visits will be undertaken by beneficiaries, visiting others who started such activities before and have gained more experience. - Caritas Nyundo will sensitize and support the constitution of self help groups, will initiate fruit and vegetable farming for households, using fertilizers and improved seeds to ensure increased production and income generation. Agro pastoral activities will also include chicken, goat, and rabbit farming, which will help in fertilizing the soil, provide food to fight malnutrition and promote money generation. - Caritas Rwanda will continue trainings of Psychosocial Animators and will provide livelihood accompaniment, such as trainings and opportunities to share experiences, for beneficiaries that benefited from such accompaniment in the past. - A workshop will be held for all psychosocial programme partners to identify together what livelihoods and households socio economic rehabilitation activities can be proposed for the forthcoming programme - A community survey and context analysis will be carried out by a specialist to summarise opportunities and make recommendations that will help draw up the forthcoming programme - If successful, this pilot project will be followed by the development of a larger programme, which will link trauma healing activities and socioeconomic rehabilitation activities, as stipulated in the CSP.
